thread.title: Spot Gold Up Amid Dollar Weakness

author: Biman Mukherji
title: Spot Gold Up Amid Dollar Weakness
text:
0225 GMT — Spot gold prices rose in Asia trade, driven by a weak dollar. Prices are likely to trade in a narrow range as investors await the release of U.S. inflation data. A result in line with consensus could help stabilize broader market jitters seen in the last 2 weeks. Unlike in past episodes of market volatility, gold prices haven’t gained much. Spot gold is up 0.3% at 1,333.09/troy ounce.
Write to Biman Mukherji at biman.mukherji@wsj.com
